captions.text: Cold tears and face
Why am I lost in you?
I didn't know
We'd hurt each other's unhealed hearts
And you'd say
Leave me this memory
Lost innocence
You're the light that shined only for me
But I won't let time trick me into its trap again
Closing my eyes without you everyday
Enough now
Even if I can never hold your hand again
Even if I have to walk an endless tunnel
I can overcome
I can live without you
Living to die
I'm worried it will become my story
At some point in the long day
I'm sure there's a place I can forget you
Sometimes I look back on us
Effort pays off honestly
Forget yesterday and get up again
Fix my shoelaces and run again
Like us written in old journals
I can't live lost like this anymore
Leaving behind innocence
Closing my eyes without you everyday
Enough now
Even if I can never hold your hand again
Even if I have to walk an endless tunnel
I can overcome
I can live without you
How my tears have fallen to the ground
I can't show you, so I keep going
My eyes, your lips
When they meet again, we'll shine
Closing my eyes without you everyday
Even if I can never hold your hand again
Even if I have to walk an endless tunnel
I can overcome
I'm alright now, without you

comments.author: VİXX REAL

comments.text:
I just wish more ㄴㅇㅅㅌ's would understand their own fandom and NU'EST, and 
that they will just have to accept that everything is changing in KPOP, 
even their own concepts. 

I've been a fan of NU'EST, since like a month, and I've started in getting 
to know them. It makes me sad since it was inevitable for me to see some of 
the fans, leaving the fandom since they've seen how the concepts of these 
boys had changed. 

Well, it's normal don't you think? A lot of KPOP groups (even your favorite 
ones) are changing their concepts, and sometimes they (the fans) don't give 
a damn about it. But why is it that when NU'EST changed their concept (a 
little), a lot of you were saying that you'll leave the fandom and were 
like disappointed with them and how they changed? 

You know, if you're a real fan of NU'EST, you will accept them for who they 
are and not by just their looks, talents or even concepts, in which it 
seems like a lot of fans were digging into (but I have to admit that TALENT 
counts). Ans not even about how you want them to do a concept like FACE and 
Action, or even Ren's blonde hair. 

“Don't be sad because it ended, smile because it happened.”―or so to say. 

You guys should be thankful since NU'EST are always doing their best to 
make US fans happy. 
And I know that somehow, they are facing a crisis with their promotions, so 
we should cheer for them, and not neglect them, and leaving their fandom, 
which is not ACTUALLY helping them.

And yep, I know that I'm just a new fan, and new fans 'don't know anything 
since you're just a newbie or whatever', but I could tell you that I knew 
already and I'm aware and greatly concerned about NU'EST, since I love them.

They might not be that much popular (no offense), but we'll just have to 
wait and support them, and maybe in the next few years, they will be one of 
the most popular groups in South Korea. Nothing is impossible, only believe 
it, and it will.

NU'EST ㄴ.ㅇ.ㅅ.ㅌ. jjang~!﻿
comments.author: Bea Carreon

comments.text:
+Fanny Lam Yes, and I also noticed how Ren also improvef his vocals, to 
even handle a bunch of lines in their new songs :) 

I can't really wait for the full MV of NA.NA.NA Namida! I love the tune and 
the choreography is great. I hope the best for them! 

Thanks for the link :3
comments.author: Bea Carreon

comments.text:
+Bea Carreon Totally agree. I like them because they do not stick to one 
concept. They are willing to try new ones. For some groups, we can expect 
what kind of songs will come with them, NU'EST surprised me everytime. They 
are really very hard-working. Just take Minhyun as example. His vocal 
skills has improved a lot and from the collaboration with a female singer 
Fromm in her recently relased album, Minhyun is so good. (Fromm - "The 
Aftermath" feat. Minhyun). Also. their upcoming 2nd Japanses 
single"NA.NA.NA.Namida" is very nice (I really hope that there will be a 
Korean version). (p.s. The full version of the MV has not been officially 
released but has been shown on a Japan TV program, so, if you want to take 
a look, try this link: www.dailymotion.com/video/x2opshi )Although it's a 
bit sad that they are not popular in Korea, I hope one day they can and 
they will.

I've been ages out of this fandom already.
I remember when they first debuted back in 2012 with FACE, they did get 
lots of attention because of the maknae, Ren. And now seeing this being 
released almost 2 years after their debut, Ren is not that cuteish, girlish 
baby faced little boy anymore. I mean, look at them abs and his hair being 
cut, and his act being so manly. I did fell for him here. 
By the way, he with this style resembles a bit of EXO's Luhan and Ji Chang 
Wook.
Noona definitely likes what she sees. :p﻿

comments.author: Bey Ka

comments.text:
+Bey Ka I know it's too late for me to answer this but still, I want to 
explain the part of Minhyun and Jr. Well, in Minhyun's scene, it only 
depicts their depression. In short, self-harm. I just didn't get why 
Minhyun represent that thing. Maybe he experience that kind of thing and 
came up with that suicidal thing? Who knows, and I hope he's not :/
And in Jr's scene.. The fish represents their success(which I've read of 
most of the comments). You see, at first Jr can't catch the fish but 
sooner, he got it and ate it. I assume that even if they failed, from time 
to time they'll achieve their success. 


You can check: 
http://nuest-stuff.tumblr.com/post/91246907287/the-meaning-behind-good-bye-bye 
for better understanding :)
comments.author: Mia Minki

comments.text:
I remember that the flower meant that Ren is letting go his flower boy 
image. Also, that Baekho doesn't feel as handsome as the other idols, so he 
tears the wallpaper to reveal a prettier one. And Aron looking out the 
window meant that he misses home. Still have no idea what they meant with 
Minhyun and JR...
